revision.text: high throughput screening is a kind of investigation which uses a standardizedassays (cell based, enzymatic or chemometric) to test the effect of substances (RNAi or small molecules) held in libraries on a very specific and measureable outcome (e.g fluorence intensity). it relies on robotic handling to ensure fast and high-throughput in assay performance, data acquisition and hit selection. Alejandra Gonzalez-Beltran Orlaith Burke Philippe Rocca-Serra AGB,PRS
